snippet: In blocking Judge Robert L. Wilkins’s nomination, Senate Republicans on Monday denied President Obama his third pick in recent weeks to fill a vacancy on the nation’s most powerful and prestigious appeals court.
abstract: Senate Republicans block Judge Robert L Wilkins’s nomination to United States Court of Appeals for District of Columbia Circuit, denying Pres Obama his third consecutive pick to fill vacancy on nation’s most powerful appeals court; move inflames bitter debate over a president's right to shape the judiciary, and Republicans are on the verge of exhausting the last bit of tolerance Democrats have shown for such regular use of the filibuster on nominations.
lead_paragraph: In blocking Judge Robert L. Wilkins’s nomination, Senate Republicans on Monday denied President Obama his third pick in recent weeks to fill a vacancy on the nation’s most powerful and prestigious appeals court.

headline.main: Obama Pick for Court Is 3rd in a Row Blocked by Republicans
headline.print_headline: Obama Nominee Is Third In A Row Blocked By G.O.P.
